page.title: 12THE LOCAL PAPER,WITHERNSEA
page.content: The Holderness Gazette on the corner of Queen Street and Seaside Road is the local paper.6,200 copies are printed every Thursday and sent to 42 towns and villages, as far as Paull,Hedon and Preston to the west, Easington to the south and Atwick and Hornsea to the north.In the Hornsea area the paper becomes the Hornsea Gazette with its own local news, but it is still printed by the same company. The paper has an office staff of 5 full-time and 3 part-time workers, including the editor,but the printing is done by a private firm in Withernsea called Lunns.The paper also uses freelance photographers.The price of the paper is 16p but if it were not for private advertising which takes up 55% of the paper the cost would be nearer Â£1.Adverts cost Â£1.05 per cm.
